title: ManageEngine Network Configuration Manager getUserAPIKey Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of ManageEngine Network Configuration Manager. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the getUserAPIKey function. The issue results from the lack of authentication prior to allowing access to functionality. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to bypass authentication on the system.
addtionnal_details: ManageEngine has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.manageengine.com/itom/advisory/cve-2022-36923.html
timeline:
2022-07-26 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-08-18 - Coordinated public release of advisory
